predictions.text: The U.S. will conduct at least one publicly acknowledged kinetic strike on Iranian territory (including air/missile strikes or special operations), confirmed by the U.S. Department of Defense or the White House.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if, by the deadline, DoD and/or the White House publicly confirms a U.S. military strike/attack occurring on Iranian territory (not merely against Iran-backed groups outside Iran). Resolves NO otherwise.
evidence: Trump weighing Iran strikes within 10 days; heightened Middle East risk premium pushed oil prices higher and weighed on global equities. (https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/19/trump-to-decide-whether-to-attack-iran-in-next-10-days-oil-prices-jump.html)

U.S. seeks “deal” pressure on Iran as Russia-Iran naval drills proceed, underscoring tighter security alignment and increased regional escalation risk. (https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/19/trump-us-iran-nuclear-talks-oil-prices-russia.html)
monitoring_signals: DoD press briefings/press releases indicating strikes
White House statements and pool reports
Reuters/AP confirmations of U.S. strikes inside Iran
NOTAMs, carrier strike group movements, CENTCOM updates
predictions.rationale: Public reporting points to an imminent decision window. Strikes remain non-base-case due to escalation and diplomatic costs, but the stated timeline elevates near-term probability.

predictions.text: ICE Brent front-month crude oil futures will settle at or above $105.00 per barrel on at least one trading day.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Brent front-month settlement price (official ICE settle) is >= 105.00 USD/bbl on any trading day by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Trump weighing Iran strikes within 10 days; heightened Middle East risk premium pushed oil prices higher and weighed on global equities. (https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/19/trump-to-decide-whether-to-attack-iran-in-next-10-days-oil-prices-jump.html)
monitoring_signals: ICE Brent daily settlement prints
Geopolitical escalation headlines (Iran/U.S./shipping security)
OPEC+ emergency statements/meetings
Physical differentials (Dated Brent) and tanker rates
predictions.rationale: A move to $105 requires either escalation or a significant supply shock; current risk premium makes a brief spike plausible but not likely.

predictions.text: OpenAI will publicly announce a single financing round (equity or equity-like) with at least $50 billion in new committed capital and a post-money valuation of at least $800 billion.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if OpenAI (or OpenAI Global LLC/related parent) publicly confirms a funding round meeting both thresholds ($50B+ new capital and $800B+ post-money valuation) via press release, blog, or SEC-style filing cited by major outlets. Otherwise NO.
evidence: OpenAI reportedly finalizing a $100B deal at >$850B valuation. (https://techcrunch.com/2026/02/19/openai-reportedly-finalizing-100b-deal-at-more-than-850b-valuation/)
Nvidia reportedly in talks to invest up to $30B in OpenAI. (https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/19/nvidia-is-in-talks-to-invest-up-to-30-billion-in-openai-source-says.html)
monitoring_signals: OpenAI official blog/press pages
Major deal reporting (WSJ/FT/Bloomberg/Reuters)
Large investor announcements (SoftBank, sovereign funds, Big Tech)
Regulatory filings by investors (e.g., 10-Q risk factors/MD&A)
predictions.rationale: The deal is already widely reported with very large figures; main risk is delays, structure changes, or capital size below threshold.

predictions.text: Nvidia will disclose (press release, 10-Q/10-K, or earnings-call prepared remarks) that it has made a direct equity investment in OpenAI totaling at least $10 billion (cumulative).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Nvidia publicly discloses a direct equity investment in OpenAI (not merely partnership/credits/supply agreements) with stated amount >= $10B cumulative by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Nvidia reportedly in talks to invest up to $30B in OpenAI. (https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/19/nvidia-is-in-talks-to-invest-up-to-30-billion-in-openai-source-says.html)
monitoring_signals: Nvidia earnings releases and 10-Q/10-K filings
OpenAI financing announcements listing participants
Investor presentations/remarks addressing strategic investments
Large stake rumors confirmed by Bloomberg/Reuters
predictions.rationale: Talks are reported, but a $10B+ disclosed equity check is unusually large and may face governance/antitrust and strategic-relationship complications.

predictions.text: Bank of Japan will leave its policy rate unchanged at every scheduled monetary policy meeting through (and including) the meeting ending on or before 2026-09-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the BoJ’s policy rate target (as stated in its post-meeting statement) is not increased or decreased at any meeting with an end date on or before 2026-09-30. Any change resolves NO.
evidence: Japan core inflation fell below BOJ’s 2% target for first time since 2022, strengthening the case for policy patience and yen-rate volatility. (https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/20/japan-core-inflation-january-boj-target-gdp-growth.html)
monitoring_signals: BoJ policy statements and meeting summaries
Japan CPI (core/core-core) prints and wage data
JPY moves and JGB curve stress
BoJ board member speeches hinting at policy shifts
predictions.rationale: Sub-2% core inflation reduces urgency to tighten; policy change still possible if wages/inflation re-accelerate or FX volatility forces action.

predictions.text: At least one U.S.-focused private credit fund/manager with reported AUM of $50 billion or more will announce a redemption gate, suspension, or materially extended withdrawal notice period for a commingled private credit vehicle, explicitly citing liquidity/withdrawal pressure.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if a manager meeting the AUM threshold publicly announces gating/suspension/extended withdrawal terms for a private credit fund (not a single-asset SPV) and cites liquidity/withdrawal pressure as a reason, by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Blue Owl’s moves stoked new worries about private credit risk and liquidity, highlighting fragility concerns in fast-growing nonbank lending markets. (https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/19/business/blue-owl-stock-private-credit.html)
monitoring_signals: Fund letters/notices reported by WSJ/FT/Bloomberg
Quarterly earnings calls of large private credit managers
Rising defaults in leveraged loans/private debt benchmarks
Secondary market discounts for private credit vehicles
predictions.rationale: Liquidity mismatch risk is a known tail; this requires a notable stress episode and public disclosure, which is not the base case.

predictions.text: U.S. Treasury (OFAC) will issue a new Russia-related General License, waiver, or formal FAQ guidance that expands (not restricts) permitted transactions for U.S. persons in Russia-linked energy or LNG projects (e.g., investment, services, or payment processing).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if OFAC publishes a Russia-related General License or FAQ that explicitly broadens authorization (relative to prior baseline) for U.S. persons’ dealings with Russia-linked energy/LNG projects or counterparties, by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Trump pursuing major commercial openings with Russia, potentially reshaping sanctions posture and Western geopolitical alignment if rapprochement deepens. (https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/19/us/politics/trump-russia-deals-novatek.html)
monitoring_signals: OFAC General Licenses/FAQs and press releases
White House statements on sanctions policy shifts
Treasury/State joint guidance on Russia energy transactions
Congressional reactions indicating sanctions constraints
predictions.rationale: A policy pivot is possible given reported commercial opening, but institutional and allied constraints make explicit sanctions easing a low-probability event.

predictions.text: The U.S. SEC will publish a proposed rule (or formal rule amendments) increasing reporting or disclosure requirements specifically for private credit/private funds (e.g., Form PF expansion or new liquidity/stress reporting).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the SEC posts a proposal on sec.gov or in the Federal Register that explicitly increases reporting/disclosure requirements for private funds with specific applicability to private credit (direct lending/private debt), by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Blue Owl’s moves stoked new worries about private credit risk and liquidity, highlighting fragility concerns in fast-growing nonbank lending markets. (https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/19/business/blue-owl-stock-private-credit.html)
monitoring_signals: SEC rulemaking agenda and public meeting notices
Federal Register proposed rules tied to Form PF/private funds
FSOC statements on nonbank credit risk
SEC Chair speeches referencing private credit
predictions.rationale: Growing attention to liquidity and systemic risk raises odds of a proposal; timing and political/legal headwinds are the main uncertainty.

predictions.text: The U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) will publicly announce a pause or deferral of new grant awards lasting at least 30 consecutive days, explicitly citing funding constraints (e.g., appropriations, budget execution, or administrative funding limits).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if NSF posts an official notice (website, Dear Colleague Letter, or press statement) stating new awards are paused/deferred for >=30 consecutive days and attributes it to funding constraints, by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Reports warn U.S. science funding cuts are driving brain drain, risking long-run innovation capacity and competitiveness in strategic technologies. (https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2026/feb/19/trump-science-funding-cuts)
monitoring_signals: NSF policy/announcements and Dear Colleague Letters
University research office alerts citing NSF award delays
Appropriations outcomes and OMB apportionment signals
AAAS/agency watchdog reporting on award cadence
predictions.rationale: Broad funding stress could force temporary award pauses, but NSF often manages constraints via slower processing rather than an explicit 30-day halt.
